title: Debra Elmegreen - Wikipedia
snippet: Debra Meloy Elmegreen (born November 23, 1952 in South Bend, Indiana) is an American astronomer. She was the first woman to graduate from Princeton University with a degree in astrophysics, and she was the first female post-doctoral researcher at the Carnegie Observatories.

title: Debra Elmegreen - Society for Science
snippet: Barrier-breaking astrophysicist Debra Elmegreen competed in the 1971 STS and 1970 ISEF. In her career, she has served as a professor of astronomy at Vassar College and president of the International Astronomical Union and American Astronomical Society...

title: Debra Elmegreen - 1400 Degrees
snippet: Debra Meloy Elmegreen is Professor Emerita of Astronomy, formerly on the Maria Mitchell Chair at Vassar College. She was the first woman to graduate with an undergraduate degree in Astrophysical Sciences from Princeton University.
